In [[computing]], '''Virtual Hard Disk''' ('''VHD''') is a technology used in [[Microsoft Virtual PC|Virtual PC]] (originally created by [[Connectix]], then bought by [[Microsoft]]). [[Virtual PC]] is a virtualization program that allows you to have multiple operating systems running at the same time. The additional operating systems are running on virtual machines, so as far as they know they're on their own computer. VHD is the file format that holds each operating system and their associated programs.
+
In [[computing]], '''Virtual Hard Disk''' ('''VHD''') is a technology used in [[Microsoft Virtual PC]] (originally created by [[Connectix]], then bought by [[Microsoft]]). [[Virtual PC]] is a virtualization program that allows you to have multiple operating systems running at the same time. The additional operating systems are running on virtual machines, so as far as they know they're on their own computer. VHD is the file format that holds each operating system and their associated programs.
Since June 2005, Microsoft has made the VHD Image Format Specification available to third parties under the [[Microsoft Open Specification Promise]]. For example the format was adopted by [[Xen|XenSource]] for what is now the [[Citrix Systems|Citrix]] XenServer hypervisor.
Since June 2005, Microsoft has made the VHD Image Format Specification available to third parties under the [[Microsoft Open Specification Promise]]. For example the format was adopted by [[Xen|XenSource]] for what is now the [[Citrix Systems|Citrix]] XenServer hypervisor.
